เทรดเดอร์ชื่อดัง Peter Brandt เตือน 'การขายในการรณรงค์' ของ Bitcoin: เหตุใดจึงเคลื่อนไปที่ $63,800 เป็นลำดับต่อไป

Legendary Trader Peter Brandt Warns of Bitcoin 'Campaign Selling': Why Move to $63,800 Is Next

1d ago//Gamza Khanzadaev
bitcoin
AI

Summary

TH

นักเทรดชื่อดัง Peter Brandt ชี้ว่าแนวโน้มลดลงของ Bitcoin ในช่วง 8 วันที่ผ่านมาไม่ใช่เพียงการขายทิ้งเพราะความตื่นตระหนก แต่เป็น 'campaign selling' หรือการขายออกตามแผนของสถาบันเพื่อลดความเสี่ยง การวิเคราะห์ทางเทคนิคของเขาชี้ว่าการแตกตัวจากรูปแบบ rising wedge นั้นบ่งชี้ถึงเป้าหมายการลดลงถัดไปที่ระดับ $63,800 หากแนวโน้มนี้ดำเนินต่อไป แรงขายครั้งนี้เกิดขึ้นพร้อมกับการล้างพอร์ตมูลค่ากว่า $850 ล้านและการปรับตัวลดลงในตลาดหลักทรัพย์และสินค้าโภคภัณฑ์

EN

Legendary trader Peter Brandt suggests that Bitcoin's recent eight-day downtrend is not random panic selling but a calculated 'campaign selling' orchestrated by institutions to reduce exposure. His technical analysis identifies a breakdown from a rising wedge pattern, setting a critical downside target of $63,800 if the current structure persists. This sell-off is accompanied by significant deleveraging, with over $850 million in liquidations recorded, mirroring broader market declines in equities and commodities.

Key Points

  • Peter Brandt identifies the current Bitcoin dip as institutional 'campaign selling' rather than random liquidation.
  • Technical analysis indicates a measured move target of $63,800 following a breakdown from a rising wedge pattern.
  • The market is witnessing synchronized deleveraging, with over $850 million in crypto liquidations occurring in 24 hours.

Article

Thu, 5/02/2026 - 10:24 Bitcoin's not panicking; it is following orders. Legendary trader Brandt spots a cold, surgical sell-off unfolding, and $63,800 BTC is marked as the next destination if this scenario goes on. Cover image via U.Today Disclaimer: The opinions expressed by our writers are their own and do not represent the views of U.Today. The financial and market information provided on U.Today is intended for informational purposes only. U.Today is not liable for any financial losses incurred while trading cryptocurrencies. We believe that all content is accurate as of the date of publication, but certain offers mentioned may no longer be available. According to veteran chartist Peter Brandt , the current eight-day downtrend on Bitcoin (BTC) shows all the hallmarks of a calculated campaign sell-off, not a random liquidation. His analysis points to two critical levels now in play: the already-breached $70,000 and a far more ominous target at $63,800, based on a measured move from the recent wedge breakdown. With over $850 million wiped out in liquidations and fear metrics collapsing, this is not a normal dip. If Brandt’s structure plays out, the market may be staring down a deeper flush that few retail holders are ready for. Who is selling Bitcoin? In his latest public Bitcoin outlook, Brandt pointed to the ongoing eight-day streak of lower highs and lower lows in BTC’s price , characterizing the formation as a textbook example of "campaign selling" — in which institutional-sized flows systematically get rid of excessive exposure to the cryptocurrency. HOT Stories His current projection outlines two major price zones: $70,000, which Bitcoin is already testing, and a deeper target near $63,800. Source: Peter Brandt Price action confirms the stress. Since the beginning of 2026, BTC has broken down from a rising wedge pattern, lost both short-term moving averages and is being pushed lower by continuous liquidation pressure worth $850 million in just 24 hours alone. In this case, $63,802.54 emerges as the full measured-move target, going along with breakdown dynamics last seen in the October 2023 collapse. You Might Also Like It is important to note that the pain is not limited to crypto: equities and commodities are also deep in red this week, reinforcing the idea of a synchronized deleveraging phase. Brandt’s annotated chart sketches out a technical playbook, not a gut call, even though he has 50 years of experience. Each price level, he points out, is derived from historical repetition — not speculative guessing. And as the formation continues to unfold, the lower boundary — $63,800 for BTC — could become the market’s next battleground. Related articles
